name: Four Seasons Hotel Miami

reviews.text: We just completed a seven night stay at the Four Seasons in Miami. Overall we were pleased with the stay but felt the hotel did not live up to our expectation of service from a Four Seasons Hotel. Noone ever addressed us by name. I thought that was a signature for Four Seasons Hotels. The service is definitely on the cold side except for the hardworking pool attendants. They worked very hard and were always asking us if everything was okay and if we needed anything. They were just great.
reviews.title: The Good and the Bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping left a lot to be desired, especially considering the usual standards of Four Seasons Hotels. We asked on numerous occassions that the dirty glasses in our room be replaced but time and after time they forgot and we had to call and ask again. One day they cleaned the room and forgot to replace the toilet paper. On some days they forgot to leave bath gel. The room was spotless but they were quite forgetful. We had asked that the mini bar be emptied and they emptied it but they also locked it so we could not store anything. We had to call the front desk to have it unlocked.
reviews.title: Great choice for Miami

reviews.text: One morning we were awakened in error by a wake up call that was meant for another room. They apologized for the error.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel lobby and pool grounds are beautiful. The rooms are medium size, well appointed, and views are okay, nothing too great. There is construction going on next to the hotel and there are two big construction cranes. We could see one of the cranes from our room.
reviews.title: Just bliss....

likes.liked: — quality of service, food, spa, surroundings
likes.disliked: — It is located in downtown miami so you will need to get taxi's if you want to go the most popular places

reviews.text: The food and drinks at the pool were pretty good but nothing fabulous.
reviews.title: Great rooms & views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long and troublesome journey from London arriving at the Four Seasons made it all worthwhile immediately. I was obviously tired and while my partner was checking in I was taken to the room to freshen up.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: After a long hot shower in the extremely well appointed bathroom I felt soooo much better.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: Everything was spotless and top quality.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area was fabulous. The staff keeping us topped up with iced water, coming round with chilled face cloths and watermelon every now and again was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The martinis before dinner were superb.
reviews.title: Fabulous Four Seasons!

reviews.text: I've been to the Four Seasons Miami about a dozen times on both business and pleasure for the last 4 years. Most people looking to visit Miami/Miami Beach should be aware that it is a party town and as a result most hotels are concerned with filling rooms, not pleasing customers. That being said, the Four Seasons Miami truly stands out with its world-class staff and commitment to excellence.
reviews.title: Friendly Service in Miami?!

likes.liked: — Good value, friendly staff, great pool
likes.disliked: — Many non-smoking rooms smell of smoke

reviews.text: Every time I've stayed here the service has been perfect, after the second visit the concierge and front desk remembered my name and greeted me with a smile at all times.
reviews.title: Great Place but only One Night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant at the four seasons, while a bit pricey, has one of the most impressive sunday brunches in all of Miami. Everything from Stone Crab Claws, to Sushi, to Smoked Salmon, to Carved Meats await your all-you-can eat gourmet food desires.
reviews.title: Luxury in Miami
The epitome of professionalism
reviews.text: One of the most relaxing parts of the four seasons is the pool, or pools for that matter. The pools are located on top of the parking garage (7 stories above ground) and overlook the Miami Bay. The pools are always well staffed and cabana service is available. Beware - you will pay four seasons prices for cocktails, so be ready for a large bill if you plan on having multiple drinks though-out the day.

Recent construction along Brickell Ave has caused some of the rooms to be noisy, while I've experienced this twice, both times the receptionist moved me to a new room on a different corner with no questions asked.
reviews.title: yes it was perfect
Great Pool, decent service
reviews.text: If you're looking for a place to just relax and sit in the sun, this is a great hotel. The pool area is large and when we were there (mid april) not too crowded at all. The pool-side service was pretty decent (not as good as other Four Seasons I've been too) but it wasnt bad at all. The food was good, but like anywhere, gets old after a few days.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Warning: this is out of the heart of the action, downtown Miami is practically a ghost town. If you want action, do not stay here! But South Beach is an easy 15 minute cab ride ($30 each way).
reviews.title: Very Good Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very nice but "standard". One king bed. sort of small, great bath. Ask for an upgrade. Who knows?
reviews.title: Great getaway

reviews.text: Friendly and professional service on par with or better than the Ritz Keybiscayne, Ritz Southbeach, and Ritz Coconut Grove. The Four Seasons two hotel guest pools are large enough for relative privacy in the low season. The pool area is much larger than the Mandarin Oriental's small infinity pool. There were more children than expected in main pool area, and children are segregated to one pool the Ritz Keybiscayne. There is no beach, and the Brickell area is quiet. Housekeeping had a few hiccups which they promptly fixed when we called. My wife loved her massage, and the gym is excellent. Expect a $30 cab to SOBE where we had a superb dinner at OLA in the Sanctuary. The location is fantastic if you have business in Miami, just be aware of the distance if you want to be in the thick of it in SOBE.
reviews.title: A nice stay.

likes.liked: — The quiet setting, the cleanliness of the rooms and public areas
likes.disliked: — Inconveniently located for anything but business; language barrier with some staff

reviews.title: A tranquil stay at the Four Seaons Miami
reviews.text: A great hotel for a quick getaway for some sun.

description: Celebrating its 10th Anniversary this year, the Four Seasons Hotel Miami is located in downtown Miami. 221 Guest rooms and suites feature Miami flair and European-style luxury within an architecturally striking tower of glass and granite that reflects the dazzling Biscayne Bay. The crown jewel of last year's multi-million dollar renovation, Edge, Steak & Bar offers an innovative, approachable menu of high-quality, interesting cuts of meat, indigenous seafood and locally-sourced fruits and vegetables. A two-acre rooftop terrace features lush landscaping, a swimming pool, separate kids’ area, and a wading pool shaded by towering majestic palms. The urban resort also features a 50,000-square-foot fitness center, spa and 15,000 square feet of function space dedicated to meetings, events and special occasions.
